result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquisha Elizabeth Walker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber Privileges for work and school.

Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22.
Probation may be terminated early at the discretion of the agent.

miscConds.notes:
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.

- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Laquisha Elizabeth Walker

records.addlTxt: Affidavit and order for payment of attorney fees and costs due from Milwaukee County signed.  Filed by:    CHRISTIN  MARIE SAINT PIERRE  $1,000.00
for Payment of Attorney Fees and Costs, signed and filed.  rmm
records.descr: Order Submitted in PDF Format Declined

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Laquisha Elizabeth Walker in court.  Attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre in court for Laquisha Elizabeth Walker.  
Prosecuting attorney Katrina Voge in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm. 
AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  
*
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.    
Defendant ordered to serve 45 DAYS in the House of Correction, credit of 0 days time served, Huber Privileges for work and school. Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 12 months with the following conditions:

- Sign up for probation no later than 10/07/22.
- No firearms or dangerous weapons.
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 
- Obtain/maintain full time school/work.
- Cooperate with the agent all conditions of probation.
- Submit a DNA sample by 10/07/22 and pay the surcharge during probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept

- Pay all MANDATORY costs, fees and surcharges during probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment/tax intercept.
- Defendant advised of his right to appeal. 

***PROBATION MAY BE TERMINATED EARLY AT THE DISCRETION OF THE AGENT***
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire, filed.  rmm

Defendant Laquisha Elizabeth Walker in court with attorney Christin Marie Saint Pierre.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing held via zoom. Status conference held. Parties have reached a resolution and are requesting a plea and sentencing date. Case is adjourned in Branch 01.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 7/11/22 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 8/1/22.  sb
Appointing Attorney at County Expense, signed and filed.  rmm

Defendant Laquisha Elizabeth Walker in court.  
Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Hearing held via Zoom.  Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Christen Saint Pierre as counsel for defendant at the rate of $100.00 per hour.  Attorney Saint Pierre accepts appointment.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 on the 1st of every month, commencing 8/01/22 until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.   Case is adjourned to Br. 1  This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties..  Status conference scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Laquisha Elizabeth Walker in court.  John J Rejowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Davila, Branch 01. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 01.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 06/07/2022@1:30p
